sub_topic: Determining the genus of a graph.
message_1: What is the genus of a complete graph K₇?
message_2:
The genus of a graph is the minimum number of handles required on a surface to embed the graph without any edge crossings. To find the genus of a complete graph Kₙ, we can use the formula:

g(Kₙ) = (n - 3)(n - 4)/12

In the case of K₇ (a complete graph with 7 vertices), we can plug in n = 7 into the formula:

g(K₇) = (7 - 3)(7 - 4)/12
g(K₇) = (4)(3)/12
g(K₇) = 12/12
g(K₇) = 1

So, the genus of a complete graph K₇ is 1.
